questions.text: A patient comes with itching in the groin since 2 months. All can cause this except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Aspergillus affects organs like nose,lung etc.skin involvement is uncommon. Option B,C,D-are the dermatophytes which affects skin. Itching in the groin indicates Dermatophytic infection in flexors –Tinea Tinea in groin is k/s Tinea cruris KOH mount will demonstrate fungal hyphae of dermatophyte Dermatophytes are : Trichophyton : affects skin, hair & nail Epidermophyton : affects skin & nail Microsporum : affects only skin & hair

questions.text: A patient presented with rashes in >30 percentage skin with hemorrhagic crusting on lips. The cause would be
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Toxic epidermal necrolysis(TEN) occurs due to drug reaction,which is characterised by skin lesions + more than or equal to 2 mucosa involved such as oral ,genital, nasal, Ocular.This condition is characterised by:- Targetoid/ Target like lesions. Central zone is necrotic, surrounded by zone of erythema in periphery. Targetoid lesions are also seen in : <10% BSA : SJS >30% BSA : TEN 10 -30% BSA : SJS TEN OVERLAP Drugs associated with severe drug rash can be remembered with a mnemonic Natural & Clear SOAP : Nevirapine, NSAIDS CARBAMAZEPINE SULPHA DRUGS OXICAMS ALLOPURINOL PHENYTOIN, PHENOBARBITONE, PENICILLIN GROUP. Option B,C,D-Viruses,Malignancy and bacterial infections can themselves cause TEN.But the most common cause is drugs.

questions.text: A child presents with dome shaped, pearly lesions on forehead. Mother also having similar lesions. The likely diagnosis is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Scabies causes burrowing lesions on finger webs and wrist. Option B-PEARLY SHINY DOME SHAPED PAPULE WITH UMBILICATION IN THE CENTER INDICATES MOLLUSCUM CONTAGIOSUM i.e, POX VIRUS. Option C-Herpes presents with grouped vesicles. Option D-HPV can present with wart like lesions in genital area.

questions.text: A patient presented with blisters. His histology is as shown. The diagnosis is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-This is a Vesiculobullous disorder in which problem lies just above stratum basale s/o suprabasal acantholysis.The characteristic Row of tombstone appearance indicates diagnosis of Pemphigus vulgaris. Option B-In Leprosy we can find epitheloid granuloma and macrophage filled with acid fast bacilli. Option C-Mycosis fungoides is a cutaneous T-cell Lymphoma characterised by collection of T lymphocytes in epidermis k/s Pautrier‘s microabscess. Option D-Psoriasis has thickening, hyperkeratosis, parakeratosis and collection of neutrophils in epidermis k/s munroe microabscess.

questions.text: A young male with painful nodulocystic lesions over face and forehead. The best management would be
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) This is a case of Grade IV acne which is characterised by nodulocysticlesions. Grade 1 : comedones: Topical retinoids like Adapalene, Tretinoin. Grade 2 :prominent papules : Topical retinoids + Topical antibiotics like clindamycin. Grade 3 : pustular stage : oral antibodies like doxycycline added. Grade 4 : Nodulocystic stage : Oral retinoids like oral isotretinoin.

questions.text: Meissner’s corpuscles are found in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Startum lucidum is a thin, clear layer of dead skin cells in the epidermis named for its translucent appearance under a microscope. Option B-Stratum basale has melanocytes and merkel receptors. Option C-Meissner‘s corpuscles are present in papillary dermis.They are Fast adapting touch receptors. Option D-The reticular dermis has blood vessels and connective tissue that supports the skin. Hair follicles, oil and sweat glands, and other structures are also found in the reticular dermis.

questions.text: The packet as shown in image is used for
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Option A is treated by HAART therapy. Option B-The packet as shown in image is used for MDR for treatment of leprosy. Red kit is for adults:- Rifampicin: 2 tablets : total 600mg once in a month. Clofazimine : 300mg once in a month and 150mg daily. Dapsone [white] : 100mg daily Child kit : Orange/ Brown colour. Rifampicin: 450mg once in a month CLOFAZIMINE :150mg once in a month – alternate day Dapsone : 50mg daily Option C-TB is treated by ATT haing HRZE as first line drugs. Option D-STDs are treated by NACO kits.

questions.text: Arrange the following blisters in order from superficial to deep: 1. Pemphigus foliaceous 2. Epidermolysis bullosa dystrophica 3. Pemphigus vulgaris 4. Bullous pemphigoid
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) PF : IgG against Dsg1 – subcorneal split. PV : IgG against Dsg3 >Dsg1-suprabasal split. BP : IgG against BP antigen2 >> BP antigen 1 -subepidermal blister near DEJ. EBD : Congenital deficiency of collagen 7-subepidermal blister.

questions.text: A child presents with the following palmar skin lesions. He also has lip lesions. Which of the following organism is the causative agent:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given image shows Target lesion which are pathognomic of erythema multiforme.they have 3 zones i.e,Dusky center,Edema (middle) and Erythema (periphery).The Most common infective/causative agent of EM is HSV TYPE 1 > MYCOPLASMA. Option B-Variant of picornavirus do not cause target lesions. Option C-Varicella Zoster virus causes eruption of grouped vesicles along a dermatome. Option D-The Most common infective/causative agent of EM is HSV TYPE 1 > MYCOPLASMA.

questions.text: Patient presenting with joint pain and mild fever. NSAIDs were prescribed by the doctor. later,he Developed pigmentation after 1 week on the tip of the nose. What may be the condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Melasma won't have joint pain and mild fever. Option B-Dengue do not cause hyperpigmentation. Option C-The given history of fever and joint pain along with centrofacial hyperpigmentation shown in the image points towards diagnosis of chickungunya. Hyperpigmentation association with chickungunya fever is macular and most commonly affects the nose and the cheeks. Nose hyperpigmentation is striking in cases of Chickungunya fever and is termed as chik sign . Option D-Fixed drug eruption won't have joint pain and mild fever.

questions.text: Patch test reading is done after how many days:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Patch test is the investigation of choice for allergic contact dermatitis It is Based on type IV Hypersensitivity reaction.We Remove the patch at 48 hour & read the patch at 96 hour.

questions.text: Topical steroids are most effective in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-In Dermal atrophy,steroids are not given as they are catabolic in nature and can themselves cause Dermal atrophy. Option B-Amon the given options,Topical steroids are most effective in Eczematous dermatitis as they are anti-inflammatory and immunosuppresive in nature. Option C-steroids are C/I in Bullous lesions due to HSV as it'll decrease immunity and increase the replication of virus. Option D-steroids are C/I in Rosacea as they'll increase the telangiectasia.

questions.text: Maximum Desmosomes are seen in which layer ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The labelled structures are:- A : anuclear Cells: stratum corneum. B : Highly pigmented, deeply stained layer : Stratum granulosum. C : Stratum Spinosum : Maximum DESMOSOMES. D : Stratum basale :deepest layer.

questions.text: A patient presents with lesions as shown after a thorn prick. The likely diagnosis is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given case scenario is s/o Chromoblastomycosis which is caused by phialophora verrucosa.There is h/o Thorn prick leading to subcutaneous fungal infection.The Clinical features are rough Verrucous growth.The HPE will show Copper penny bodies /Medler /muriform /sclerotic bodies. Option B-Rhinosporidiosis has mulberry like polypoidal lesions arising from mucosa such as nose. Option C-Mycetoma presents with swelling,sinuses and sulphur granules. Option D-TB can present with verrucous lesions k/s TB verrucosa cutis.

questions.text: A female comes with unilateral lesions as shown in the image. She also has Leucotrichia. The diagnosis is likely to be
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Segmental vitiligo :Hypopigmented lesions on a dermatomal pattern, not crossing midline, on a single segment. Option B-Focal vitiligo : small depigmented lesions, seen on more than 1 side, seen on both the sides, irrespective of midline. Option C-Piebaldism :genetic condition seen in children characterised by white forelock and islands of hypopigmentation. Option D-Nevus depigmentosus: Congenital defect in melanocyte migration characterised by Hypopigmented patch with serrated margin.

questions.text: A patient presents with lesions as shown. The diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Plaque with sloping outer margin and perpendicular inner margin is s/o inverted saucer shape appearance/ punched out appearance/ swiss cheese appearance which is seen in Borderline Borderline leprosy. Option B-Borderline lepromatous leprosy is characterized by numerous symmetrical small macules, papules, plaques, and nodules. Option C-Lepromatous (LL) leprosy is the multibacillary form defined by Early symptoms of nasal stuffiness, discharge, and bleeding. Swelling and thickening of limbs, especially ankles and legs with subsequent ulceration. Widespread poorly defined hypopigmented and erythematous macules with a shiny surface and normal sensation. Option D-Histoid leprosy is characterized by cutaneous and subcutaneous nodules. Histoid leprosy cases represent probable resistant bacilli.

questions.text: An adult presents with itchy hyperpigmented plaque with exudation on the flexure of the elbow and back of knee as shown. The diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-psoriasis is a disease of Extensors with well defined erythematous plaque with silvery micaceous scale. Option B-The Characteristic location for development of Atopic dermatitis is Flexures like flexure of the elbow and back of knee.The features are itchy hyperpigmented plaque with exudation.Family history or history of atopy present like h/o asthma. The Treatment includes Topical steroids in active stage. Option C-dermatitis herpetiformis also has Extensor distribution with multiple vesicle/erosions associated with intense itch. Option D-Pemphigus presents with flaccid bulla & mucosal involvement is seen.

questions.text: A child comes with patchy hair loss, itching and scaling on the scalp as shown. The next best step is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Endothrix is a dermatophyte infection of the hair that invade the hair shaft and internalize into the hair cell resulting in break in hair resulting in a black dot as shown in figure.KOH mount is used to diagnose fungal infections. Option B-Giemsa staining is not used for endothrix. Option C-Biopsy is not routinely used for endothrix. Option D-Tzanck smear is made for diagnosis of herpes viruses.

questions.text: Match the following
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The image below shows NACO kits.

questions.text: A patient comes with painful vesicles on genitals. The histopathology finding will be:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-painful vesicles on genitals are seen in HSV-2.The Tzanck smear will show presence of multinucleated giant cells. Option B-Pund cells are seen in donovanosis. Option C-Henderson Peterson bodies is a feature of molluscum contagiosum. Option D-Koilocytes are seen in human papilloma virus.

questions.text: A patient was treated with steroids for Psoriasis. On stopping the treatment, he develops fever, malaise, and lesion as seen in the image below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Staphylococcal infection won't occur on stopping the steroids. Option B-folliculitis happens when a hair follicle becomes infected or inflamed. This condition may look like acne, often starting out as small red bumps. Option C-Subcorneal pustular dermatosis is characterised by numerous soft pustules at the skin surface. They usually appear on the trunk, particularly in the skin folds such as the armpits and groin. They may appear on otherwise normal skin, but there are often within a red patch. The pustules resolve over a few days and are replaced by fine scale before there is another relapse and new pustules form again. Option D-We Never give systemic corticosteroids in psoriasis as When steroids are withdrawn,it leads to sudden outburst of inflammation known as Rebound phenomenon.Unstable varieties can manifest either as generalized erythema & exfoliation known as erythrodermic psoriasis or with multiple subcorneal sterile pustules known as Acute generalized pustular psoriasis.

questions.text: All the following infections present with maculopapular rash except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A,B,D-Dengue (during febrile phase),Rubella and measles all can present with maculopapular rash. Option C-Shingles is another name for herpes zoster.It shows grouped vesicular lesions on the background of erythema over a single dermatome.It is a painful condition.It never presents with macule or papule.Shingles occur 2° to VZV.

questions.text: A patient presents with flaccid bullous lesions involving the oral cavity and the skin. He has lesion as shown in the below picture. Acantholytic cells are seen on Tzanck smear. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A,B,C-Vesiculobullous disorders are classified as- A. Flaccid bulla : intra epidermal split :Pemphigus group : 1. Pemphigus foliaceous : mucosa spared 2. Pemphigus vulgaris: mucosa involved B. Tense Bulla : subepidermal split :bullous Group : bullous pemphigoid. Option D-Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a chronic, intensely itchy, blistering skin manifestation of gluten-sensitive enteropathy, commonly known as celiac disease.

questions.text: Which of the following is a true association
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Metabolic syndrome is associated with psoriasis.It is characterised by Obesity, DM, hyperlipidemias,CVS accidents. According to the NCEP ATP III definition, metabolic syndrome is present if three or more of the following five criteria are met: 1.waist circumference over 40 inches (men) or 35 inches (women) 2.blood pressure over 130/85 mmHg 3.fasting triglyceride (TG) level over 150 mg/dl 4.fasting high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol level less than 40 mg/dl (men) or 50 mg/dl (women) and 5.fasting blood sugar over 100 mg/dl.

questions.text: Treatment of multibacillary leprosy is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Paucibacillary leprosy: 1. Skin lesion 1 to 5 2. Nerve involvement +/- 3. SSS negative Treatment:3 DRUGS FOR 6 MONTHS : MULTIBACILLARY leprosy: 1. skin lesion >5 2. Nerve involvement >2 3. SSS positive Treatment:3 drugs for 12 months

choices.text: Epithelial cells present with bacteria on margins

questions.text: A female came with foul smelling grey white discharge and on examination, one of these will be seen on slides:-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Foul smelling discharge with white colour indicates Bacterial vaginosis.On Microscopy,clue cells are seen(Epithelial cells present with bacteria on margins). Option B-Bacteria engulfed by macrophages are k/s pund cells,seen in donovanosis. Option C-Neutrophils engulfing bacteria are seen in gonorhhea. Option D-Budding yeasts are seen in candidiasis.

questions.text: A patient presents with a bald patch on the scalp with easy pluckability of hair. Physician noticed black spots on the area. Treatment to be given will be-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Amphotericin B is a very toxic drug,hence given in life threatening situations like meningitis. Option B-Fluconazole is given for candidiasis. Option C-Black spot associated with hair loss indicates fungal infection k/s black dot/endothrix.The TOC is antifungal drug which is griseofulvin. Option D-Ciclopirox olamine is available as nail lacquer for onychomycosis.

questions.text: An alcoholic patient presents with lesions as shown. He also has diarrhea. Deficiency of which of the following is associated with it.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The given case scenario is of Pellagra which occurs due to Vitamin B3 :Niacin deficiency. This occurs in people taking Maize/Jowar as staple Diet which is poor in tryptophan.The clinical features are Diarrhoea, dermatitis [photodermatitis], dementia and death.Casal‘s necklace is a medical sign in which there is a redness and darkening of the skin around the neck as shown.

questions.text: Which nerve biopsy is taken to diagnose neuritic leprosy?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,C-Biopsy is Never taken from motor nerve like Median nerve and Ulnar nerve. Option B,D-Biopsy is taken from superficial nerve which are purely sensory in nature like Radial cutaneous nerve>Sural nerve.

questions.text: Which component of cement causes allergic contact dermatitis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,C-Cobalt and Iron are less commonly associated with allergic contact dermatitis. Option B-Nickel is present in metal jewellery. Option D-POTASSIUM DICHROMATE IS the allergen present in cement which causes allergy.

questions.text: A young patient presents with fever with rash as shown. The diagnosis would be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Dengue hemorrhagic fever presents with petechial rash. Option B-Fever and rash with purpuric angulated margins is seen in Meningococcemia. Option C-Leptospirosis can also present with hemorrhages in conjunctiva. Option D-Scrub typhus presents with eschar.

questions.text: There is a history of prick with vegetative matter in a person after which he developed these linear lesions over his hand. What is the causative agent?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-M. Scrofuloderma causes ulcer k/s scrofuloderma. Option B-M. Ulcerans causes buruli ulcer. Option C-The given image shows Linear, sporotrichoid pattern pf spread along the lymphatics.This is seen in Sporothrix schenckii following injury with rose thorn.Mycobacterium marinum & Nocardia can also present like this in a linear lymphatic pattern. Option D-Phialophora species causes chromoblastomycosis.

questions.text: Which of the following treatment is not useful in middle aged female with the given picture?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The age of the patient and the presence of Papules and Pustules with an erythematous base on the face are suggestive of Acne. All the above agents are useful in the treatment of acne except topical Fluocinolone ( topical Steroid) . Corticosteroids may provoke an acneform reaction irrespective of their route of administration.Hence,Never give steroids in treatment of acne. Option B,C,D-Topical tazarotene,Benzoyl peroxide and Topical antibiotic are commonly used in acne.

questions.text: A child with asymptomatic lesion at dorsum of arm and forearm, shaft of penis. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches. Option B-The given image shows an aggregate of pinhead -sized Papules over the forearm of a child which is suggestive of Lichen nitidus. They can be found on any part of the body but the sites of predilection are the forearm , penis , abdomen ,chest . Lichen nitidus is considered to be a variant of Lichen planus as both are histologically similar in earlier stages . Option C-Scabies presents with burrows on finger webs and wrist. Option D-Molluscum presents with pearly white dome shaped papules with umbilication.

questions.text: A 60 year old male came with tense bullae on urticarial base associated with severe itching as shown in image. After some time the roof of the bullae got settled. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a chronic, intensely itchy, blistering skin manifestation with grouped vesicles seen in gluten-sensitive enteropathy, commonly known as celiac disease. Option B-Bullous Pemphigoid is seen mainly in elder age group with tense blisters (subepidermal disease), associated with severe itching. Option C-Pemphigus vulgaris presents with Flaccid bulla. Option D-For IgA pemphigus also, there should be Flaccid bulla.

questions.text: A patient came with vesicular lesions over single dermatome over the chest, he also complaints of pain. diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Herpes zoster presents with painful Grouped vesicles over single dermatome over the chest. Option B- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches.

questions.text: A man from Bihar with childhood history of prolonged fever with nodular lesions on face and neck. There was no hypoesthesia & nerve thickening. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The past history of fever in childhood with normal sensation with nodular lesions on face and neck indicates Post kala azar dermal leishmaniasis. Option B-Silver poisoning is relatively uncommon. Option C-Tuberculoid leprosy is a form of leprosy characterized by solitary skin lesions that are asymmetrically distributed with few lesions and well demarcated borders.

questions.text: Itching with vaginal discharge is seen in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

choices.text: Half of the new cases shows remission each year
Children remission more than in adult
Indeterminate leprosy shows remission more than tuberculoid leprosy

questions.text: Incorrect about leprosy?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-90-95% cases show remission every year not 50%. Option B-Children undergo remission more than adult is a true statement. Option C-75% resolve spontaneously without treatment. Option D-Indeterminate leprosy shows remission more than tuberculoid leprosy is a true statment.

questions.text: A pregnant lady on leprosy treatment presented with type 2 lepra reaction. What will be the line of management.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Do not stop MDT in lepra reaction. Option B-Thalidomide is contra-indicated In pregnancy. Option C-Type 2 Lepra reaction or Erythema Nodosum Leprosum (ENL) is an immune complex mediated syndrome (type 3 hypersensitivity) affecting the skin , nerves and other organs.The treatment of choice for a pregnant lady with type 2 Lepra reaction is to continue Multi-drug therapy(MDT) and start oral steroids. MDT is safe in pregnancy. Option D-Azathioprine can be added later.

questions.text: What is the treatment of a male with hypopigmented patch having thickened nerve & satellite lesions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The symptoms you describe — a hypopigmented patch, thickened nerve, and satellite lesions — suggest leprosy (Hansen's disease). This is supported by the clinical presentation, which typically includes skin lesions and nerve involvement, with nerve thickening being a key finding. In leprosy treatment, the World Health Organization (WHO) provides a multi-drug therapy (MDT) regimen that differs based on the type and severity of the disease. The treatment regimen is divided into two categories based on the form of the disease: • Type A (which includes paucibacillary leprosy, with fewer lesions, less severe symptoms, and less bacillary load). • Type B (which includes multibacillary leprosy, characterized by more lesions, more nerve involvement, and a higher bacillary load). The treatment regimen is as follows: • Kit A (for paucibacillary leprosy): This is typically used for patients with less than 5 lesions and is treated for 6 months. • Kit B (for multibacillary leprosy): This is used for patients with more extensive lesions and more nerve involvement and is treated for 12 months. Given the description: • Hypopigmented patches with thickened nerves and satellite lesions strongly suggest multibacillary leprosy.

questions.text: Kassowitz law is related to?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Kassowitz law was observed in Congenital syphilis i.e,if a woman with untreated syphilis has series of pregnancies, the likelihood of infection of the fetus in later pregnancies becomes less.

questions.text: An old man presented with polymorphic lesions in Dermatomal distribution. He complaints of spider crawling sensation at night on the affected area
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-ACD (Allergic contact dermatitis) is a form of contact dermatitis that is the manifestation of an allergic response caused by contact with a substance.It presents with itching and oozing. Option B-Irritant contact dermatitis (ICD) is caused by repeated exposure to substances that aggravate the skin. Common examples of such substances are water (such as in repeated hand washing), soaps and detergents, acidic substances, solvents and other industrial chemicals. Option C-Chickenpox is an illness caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It brings on an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters. Option D-Grouped vesicles along a Dermatomal distribution with spider crawling sensation at night on the affected area indicates herpes zoster.

questions.text: Match the following
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) P. rosea shows collarette/cigarette paper scale. Psoriasis shows silvery scales. Pityriasis lichenoides chronica shows mica like scales. P. versicolor shows branny scales.

questions.text: A young boy/10 year old complaints of arthritis, papules and rash as shown. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Juvenile idiopathic arthritis can cause persistent joint pain, swelling and stiffness. Option B-The given image shows Gottron’s papules wjhich are characteristic feature of juvenile dermatomyositis.The Proximal muscle involvement is seen.Erythema around eyelids k/s heliotrope rash is also seen.Rough hands –mechanic hands and Shawl sign are other features. Option C-sclerodactyly: a scleroderma in which the fingers become thin and shiny with sclerotic skin at the tip, which is due to subcutaneous and intracutaneous calcinosis and diffused fibrosis of the collagen. Option D-SLE causes malar rash.

questions.text: A Farmer with history of wart/cauliflower lesion on foot. Histology as shown is s/o?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Chromoblastomycosis is an infection under the skin caused by fungi. It occurs sporadically in tropical and subtropical climates, and its global incidence is unknown. The infection can be disfiguring, causing wart-like lesions of the skin which spread slowly to adjacent areas.It shows copper penny/sclerotic/medlar/muriform bodies on HPE. Option B-Budding yeast is seen in candidal infections. Option C-Broad base budding is seen in blastomycosis. Option D-Splendore hoeppli phenomenon is seen in sporotrichosis.

choices.text: Living with the patient for >6 months
Close contact for > 20 hrs per week

questions.text: For starting chemotherapy in leprosy which of the following should be met?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

choices.text: Wood lamp examination showing green fluorescence
Wood lamp examination showing yellow fluorescence
Wood lamp examination showing blue fluorescence
Wood lamp examination showing coral pink fluorescence

questions.text: A 24 year old diabetic female with bilateral brown pigmentation in axilla and groin. which of the following is the correct match:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A :Wood lamp examination showing green fluorescence is seen in infection secondary to pseudomonas. Option B :Wood lamp examination showing yellow fluorescence is seen in Pityriasis versicolor Option C :Wood lamp examination showing blue fluorescence is seen in microsporum species causing T. Capitis. Option D :Wood lamp examination showing coral pink fluorescence is seen in Erythasma caused by cornyebacterium minutissimum,which presents as bilateral brown pigmentation in axilla and groin.

questions.text: Identify the image given below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Single lesion at the site of bite undergoes crusting is s/o eschar,which is seen in Scrub Typhus. Option B-Rocky mountain spotted fever classically include the triad of fever, headache, and a petechial or maculopapular rash. Option C-Rickettsia rickettsii is the causative agent for Rocky mountain spotted fever. Option D-Rickettsia conorii causes indian tick typhus.

questions.text: The patient presented with progressive proximal muscle weakness and facial rash. What is the image given below indicates?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A patient presented with multiple dome shapped lesions. The classical histopathology finding
questions.solution: Correct Answer(A)

questions.text: Drug of choice for type 2 lepra reaction in pregnancy is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-For both type 1 & 2 lepra reaction,DOC is Steroids. Option B-Most effective drug for type 2 lepra reaction: Thalidomide But It is highly teratogenic drug, hence, not given in pregnancy & reproductive age group women. Option C-Chloroquine can be used in both type 1 & 2 lepra reaction. Option D-Dapsone is not given for lepra reaction.

questions.text: A patient presents with lymphatic dissemination of his disease as shown in the picture. All the following can cause this, except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The given image shows Linear spread along lymphatics k/s sporotrichoid pattern of spread which is seen in:- A.Nocardia infection C.Sporothrix infection D. Mycobacterium marinum infection

questions.text: Causes of Non-scarring Alopecia are all except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Alopecia :- NON SCARRING : 3A 3T Alopecia areata Androgenic Alopecia Anagen effluvium Trichotillomania telogen effluvium tinea capitis [non-inflammatory] 2. SCARRING Lichen planus DLE frontal fibrosing Alopecia T. Capitis [inflammatory]

questions.text: Vesicular rash as shown in image. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given image shows vesicular lesions on hand,foot and mouth.Hence,It is a case of Hand, foot and mouth disease caused by Coxsackie A16 virus. Option B-Roseola is a common infection that usually affects children by age 2. It's caused by a virus that spreads from person to person. It can cause a high fever followed by a rash that doesn't itch. Option C,D-Dengue and zika causes petechial rash.

questions.text: A Young HIV patient with lesions over genitals with h/o contact with CSW. What is the microscopic finding shown in the given below image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-This is a case of Molluscum contagiosum which shows henderson peterson bodies on microscopy,which is an Intracytoplasmic inclusion body. Option B-Intranuclear inclusion is seen in herpes viruses. Option C-Bacteria with bipolar staining is seen in donovanosis. Option D-Multinucleate giant cells is seen in HSV.

questions.text: Identify the following lines in dermatology:
questions.solution: Correct Answer(B)

questions.text: Match the finding of column A with best alternative in column B
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is false
Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is true
Both the statements are true and 2 is the correct explanation of 1
Both the statements are true but 2 is not the correct explanation of 1

questions.text: Statement 1- Histopathological examination of a patient with flaccid bulla and painful erosions showing suprabasal blister and inflammatory infiltrate in the blister cleft is seen in pemphigus vulgaris. Statement 2- Row of tombstones appearance is diagnostic of Pemphigus vulgaris.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Both the statements are true but 2 is not the correct explanation of 1 For Row of tombstones appearance, you should have loss of desmosomes and intact hemidesmosomes, which is not mentioned in statement 1.

questions.text: A patient on Anti PD1 immunotherapy (Nivolumab) comes with pruritis, eczema, and urticarial rashes. Histopathological examination reveals subepidermal blister and direct immunofluorescence of the lesions showed Linear C3 and IgG on basement membrane. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a chronic, intensely itchy, blistering skin manifestation of gluten-sensitive enteropathy, commonly known as celiac disease. Option B-Bullous Pemphigoid is an autoimmune pruritic skin disease which typically occurs in people over 60 years. It involves the formation of anti-hemidesmosome IgG antibodies. Subepidermal blisters are formed, and tense bullae erupt most commonly at the inner thighs and upper arms with pruritus.Direct immunofluorescence of the lesions shows Linear C3 and IgG on basement membrane.Treatment includes topical steroids. Option C,D-Pemphigus vulgaris and Pemphigus foliaceous presents with flaccid blister.

choices.text: Christmas tree appearance of Pityriasis rosea

questions.text: A patient with following itchy scaly skin lesion. what is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer(A)

questions.text: In which of the following, we have non scarring alopecia a) Alopecia areata b) Frontal fibrosing alopecia C) Androgenic alopecia d) Telogen effluvium
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Alopecia :- NON SCARRING : 3A 3T Alopecia areata Androgenic Alopecia Anagen effluvium Trichotillomania telogen effluvium tinea capitis [non-inflammatory] 2. SCARRING Lichen planus DLE frontal fibrosing Alopecia T. Capitis [inflammatory]

questions.text: A 60 year old patient presented with the following lesions, Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Basal cell carcinoma presents with nodular lesion on sun exposed areas such as face with beaded rolled out margins. Option B-Squamous cell carcinoma presents with everted margins. Option C-Malignat melanoma shows variegated colours. Option D-Bowen's Disease is a carcinoma in situ seen on penis.

questions.text: A young male presented with itchy rash on the trunk as shown in the image, Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-This is an image of Christmas tree appearance of rash which is seen in Pityriasis Rosea. Option B-Wickham's striae are white lacy lesions seen in Lichen planus. Option C-The Woronoff ring is a ring-like hypopigmentation zone around regressing psoriasis lesions. Option D-Shingles is characterised by vesicular lesions in a Dermatomal distribution.

questions.text: A 13 year old Obese girl presented with velvety plaque on the neck as shown, Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Acanthosis nigricans is a condition that causes areas of dark, thick velvety skin in body folds and creases. It typically affects the armpits, groin and neck. Acanthosis nigricans tends to affect people with obesity. Option B-Cushing's syndrome presents with buffalo hump on the back of neck with central obesity and thin extremities.

questions.text: Row of tomb stone appearance is seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Pemphigus Vulgaris occurs due to Anti DSG 3>1.It shows a suprabasal split resulting in Row of tomb stone appearance. Option B-Bullous pemphigoid shows subepidermal split. Option C-Dermatitis herpetiformis shows papillary microabscesses. Option D-Herpes Labialis shows multinucleated giant cells on Tzanck smear.

questions.text: Apocrine sweat glands are present on which part of the body?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A,B,D-Eccrine sweat glands occur over most of the body like scalp,pam and soles,face etc. and open directly onto the skin's surface. Option C-Apocrine glands open into the hair follicle, leading to the surface of the skin. Apocrine glands develop in areas with many hair follicles, such as on the armpits and groin.

questions.text: All of the following presents as annular plaque except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Pityriasis Rosea shows annular plaques with collarette scales. Option B-Among the options provided, the condition that does not typically present as an annular plaque is Urticaria. Option C-Porokeratosis is a rare, acquired or inherited disorder of keratinization characterized by one or more atrophic macules or annular patches, each surrounded by a distinctive hyperkeratotic, ridge-like border called a "cornoid lamella". Option D-Tinea corporis shows annular lesions.

questions.text: Which antileprosy medicine causes pigmentation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Rifampicin is hepatotoxic with various side effects like red urine. Option B-A frequent side effect of clofazimine is deep brown pigmentation, which particularly affects the areas of skin with leprosy lesions. Upon prolonged treatment, clofazimine extensively bioaccumulates and precipitates throughout the organism, forming crystal-like drug inclusions (CLDIs). Because of the drug's red color, it is widely believed that clofazimine bioaccumulation results in skin pigmentation. Option C-Dapsone causes hemolytic anemia. Option D-Ofloxacin can cause tendinitis.

questions.text: Which type of vitiligo is stable?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Stable vitiligo was defined as having no new lesions and no progression of existing lesions for at least 2 years While unstable vitiligo was defined as new lesions or progression of existing lesions over the past 6 weeks. As for disease inactivity, segmental vitiligo usually becomes inactive after the disease has been stable for 2 years; however, non-segmental vitiligo is prone to reactivation, even after prolonged periods of stability.

questions.text: Which STI has developed drug resistance?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,C,D-In Syphilis,Chancroid and Donovanosis,Resistance is uncommon. Option B-Gonorrhea has developed resistance to nearly all the antibiotics used for its treatment. Currently down to one last recommended and effective class of antibiotics, cephalosporins, to treat this common infection.

questions.text: Match the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The patch test is the gold standard test used to detect type IV reaction (delayed hypersensitivity),done for allergic contact dermatitis. Lupus vulgaris is persistent and progressive form of cutaneous TB. Small sharply defined reddish-brown papules merge into plaques with a gelatinous consistency (called apple-jelly nodules). Lesions persist for years, leading to disfigurement and sometimes skin cancer. Skin biopsy is diagnostic. Tinea capitis is diagnosed by clinical appearance and by potassium hydroxide wet mount of plucked hairs or of hairs and scale obtained by scraping or brushing. The Split skin smear consists of a microbiological examination through Ziehl-Neelsen staining in smears of dermal scrapings from the earlobes, elbows, and knees as well as skin lesions to detect M. leprae.

questions.text: A pregnant female with foul smelling vaginal discharge. Whiff test was found positive, Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-foul smelling vaginal discharge which is off white in colour,along with positive whiff test is s/o Bacterial vaginosis. Option B-Candidiasis causes curdy white discharge. Option C-Trichomoniasis causes green frothy,foul smelling discharge.

questions.text: Urethritis in male can be due to all except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Neisseria can cause Urethritis in male within 1 week of sexual intercourse. Option B-Trichomonas can also be transmitted sexually resulting in urethritis in male. Option C-Gardenella causes bacterial vaginosis in females.It do not affect males. Option D-Mycoplasma can use urethritis in males.

questions.text: Which of the following does not differentiate psoriasis from other arthropathies
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Pitting in nails is present in 90% of psoriatic arthritis patients. Option B-Enthesitis is the medical term for inflammation of one or more entheses, which are sites where tendons and ligaments attach to bones,which can also be seen in psoriasis. Option C-Dactylitis in psoriasis can result in sausage shaped finger. Option D-Diarrhoea is seen in IBD associated arthritis,not in psoriasis.

questions.text: Which of the following causes infection due to bare foot walking?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Madurella Mycetoma causes infection due to bare foot walking resulting in mycetoma,characterised by swelling,sinuses and sulphur granules. Option B,C-Nocardia and Aspergillus can spread by air. Option D-Curvularia lunata is a causative agent of onychomycosis.

questions.text: Topical Antifungal used in treatment of Fungal infection?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Griseofulvin is oral drug for T.capitis. Option B-Tavabarole is a Topical Antifungal used in treatment of Fungal infection. Option C-Caspofungin is given as an i.v. injection. Option D-Itraconazole can be given orally.

questions.text: A Gardner who resides in sub-Himalayan area came with nodules on the forearm. What is the causative agent.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Sporotrichosis, caused by the dimorphic fungus Sporothrix schenckii, is currently distributed throughout the world, especially in tropical and subtropical zones. Infection generally occurs by traumatic inoculation of soil, plants, and organic matter contaminated with the fungus.It shows rosette like condidia. Option B-Cryptococcus causes pneumonia and meningitis. Option C-Staphylococcus do not show conidia. Option D-Blastomycosis shows broad based budding.

questions.text: Non scarring alopecia is a feature of all except? 1. Androgenic alopecia 2. Tinea capitis 3. Frontal fibrosing alopecia 4. Alopecia areata 5. Telogen effluvium
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) 1. Androgenic alopecia This is a classic example of non-scarring alopecia, where hair follicles are miniaturized but not destroyed, so the scalp does not show scarring. 2. Tinea capitis This is a fungal infection of the scalp. It can present as both scarring and non-scarring alopecia, but typically in the early stage, it causes non-scarring alopecia. However, some forms (like kerion) may cause scarring if untreated. 3. Frontal fibrosing alopecia This is a type of scarring alopecia, characterized by fibrosis and permanent destruction of hair follicles. So, this is a scarring alopecia, NOT non-scarring. 4. Alopecia areata This is a well-known non-scarring alopecia where the hair follicles remain intact but hair falls out in patches. 5. Telogen effluvium This is also a non-scarring alopecia, caused by premature transition of hair follicles into the shedding phase.

questions.text: A patient with pruritic urticarial skin lesions presented with Linear deposits of IgG/c3 on direct immunofluorescence. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Bullous pemphigoid is a subepidermal blistering disorder characterized by pruritic urticarial lesions and tense bullae. On direct immunofluorescence (DIF), it shows linear deposits of IgG and C3 along the basement membrane zone, which is diagnostic. It primarily affects older adults and is associated with autoantibodies against hemidesmosomal proteins (BP180 and BP230). Incorrect Options: A. Pemphigus vulgaris Shows intercellular (net-like or fishnet) IgG deposition within the epidermis on DIF. Lesions are flaccid bullae with mucosal involvement, not urticarial plaques. B. Dermatitis herpetiformis Presents with grouped vesicles and intense itching, usually on extensor surfaces. DIF shows granular IgA deposition at the dermal papillae, not linear IgG/C3. C. Pemphigus foliaceous Similar to pemphigus vulgaris but more superficial, with crusted erosions rather than bullae.

questions.solution: Correct Answer(B)

choices.text: Epithelial cell with bacteria at the border
Epithelial cells with bacteria inside the cells

questions.text: What are clue cells?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Clue cells are vaginal epithelial cells that appear fuzzy or stippled under the microscope because they are coated with bacteria, particularly Gardnerella vaginalis, which is the main organism involved in bacterial vaginosis. These bacteria adhere to the surface of the epithelial cells, giving them a granular, obscured border, hence the term “clue cell” because it provides a diagnostic clue for bacterial vaginosis. Incorrect Options: B. Macrophage engulfed Doderlein bacillus: This is incorrect. Doderlein bacilli are actually Lactobacilli, which are normal flora of the vagina and help maintain an acidic pH. Their presence is normal, and they are not typically engulfed by macrophages in disease conditions like bacterial vaginosis. C. Neutrophil infiltration in cervical mucosa: This would suggest inflammation or infection, possibly cervicitis, but it has nothing to do with clue cells. Clue cells are not related to neutrophil activity but to epithelial cells with surface bacteria. D. Epithelial cells with bacteria inside the cells: Clue cells are defined by bacteria on the surface of the epithelial cells, not inside them. Intracellular bacteria suggest other infections like Chlamydia, but not clue cells.

questions.text: Scabies treatment in Infant? (multiple choice) A. 5% permethrin B. 25% benzoyl benzoate C. Ivermectin D. 10%Crotamiton

questions.text: A patient with asymptomatic plaque on the sides of the neck. There is no systemic involvement. What test needed in management?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Skin Biopsy (Correct Answer): A skin biopsy is the gold standard for diagnosing a wide variety of skin conditions, especially when dealing with a plaque whose etiology is not immediately apparent. An asymptomatic plaque, by its very nature, lacks the overt symptoms (like pain, itching, or inflammation) that might point to a specific infectious or inflammatory cause. Without systemic involvement, the issue is localized to the skin. A skin biopsy allows for the microscopic examination of tissue, revealing the specific cellular and architectural changes that define different dermatological diseases. This can include conditions such as elastosis perforans serpiginosa, pseudoxanthoma elasticum (which can have skin-limited presentations despite being a systemic disorder), various forms of lichen planus, benign tumors, or other less common dermatoses. By obtaining a tissue sample, the pathologist can definitively identify the underlying pathology, leading to an accurate diagnosis and guiding appropriate treatment or reassurance. Incorrect Option: A. Chest X-ray (Incorrect Answer): A chest X-ray is a diagnostic imaging test used to visualize the structures within the chest, primarily the lungs, heart, and bones. It is indicated when there are concerns about pulmonary diseases, cardiac issues, or systemic conditions that manifest in the chest (e.g., sarcoidosis, metastatic cancer affecting the lungs). Since the patient presents with an isolated skin plaque and explicitly "no systemic involvement," a chest X-ray would be an unnecessary and irrelevant investigation for the immediate diagnosis and management of the skin condition. B. HIV test (Incorrect Answer): An HIV test screens for the Human Immunodeficiency Virus, which can lead to various dermatological manifestations in immunocompromised individuals. While some skin conditions are more prevalent or present atypically in HIV-positive patients, an asymptomatic, isolated plaque on the neck, in the absence of any other signs of immunodeficiency, risk factors for HIV, or widespread/atypical skin lesions commonly associated with HIV, does not warrant an HIV test as the primary diagnostic step. The skin finding itself does not strongly suggest HIV as the underlying cause in this specific presentation. C. KOH mount/Tzanck (Incorrect Answer): This option combines two distinct rapid diagnostic tests: KOH mount (Potassium Hydroxide mount): This test is used to identify fungal elements (hyphae, spores) in skin, hair, or nail samples. It's typically performed when a fungal infection (like tinea corporis) is suspected, which usually presents as a scaly, itchy, erythematous, or annular plaque. An asymptomatic, non-scaly plaque is less likely to be a primary fungal infection. Tzanck smear: This cytological test is used to detect viral infections, particularly herpes simplex virus (HSV) and varicella-zoster virus (VZV), by identifying multinucleated giant cells and acantholytic cells. These viral infections typically cause vesicular (blister-like) or ulcerative lesions, often accompanied by pain or itching, not stable, asymptomatic plaques. Therefore, neither a KOH mount nor a Tzanck smear is appropriate for evaluating an asymptomatic, non-vesicular, non-scaly plaque.

questions.text: Which is correct? A. Epidermis can regenerate from bulb and sebaceous glands B. Stratum corneum is the outermost cellular layer C. Epidermis is derived from outer ectoderm D. Dermis and hypodermis is from endoderm
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A,)

questions.text: Topical corticosteroids, what are the side effects? A. Hypertrichosis B. Atrophy C. Bluish grey discolouration D. Acne
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Tight junctions are present in which side of the cell?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)
